results.content: This lecture is one of the bookstore E-Commerce course series by Le Deng. It will be a great example of real world project for Spring boot project followers.
results.content_html: This lecture is one of the bookstore E-Commerce course series by Le Deng. It will be a great example of real world project for Spring boot project followers.

results.content:
Just finished this course. It is not a course for beginners to Java/Spring. If you have no previous knowledge of spring MVC, spring data, spring security, then you may want to avoid this course because there isn't much explanation given on these topics. The instructor assumes that you have knowledge of these (among many others) and most of it is never explained. Other technologies that are used but not taught include: Thymeleaf, Spring boot, Javascript, JQuery, CSS, Bootstrap, JPA entities and relationships.

All that aside, if you have some knowledge of the above and want to learn somewhat advanced topics, this is a good course. Some of the things you will learn to implement include creating shopping carts, placing checkout orders, sending automatic confirmation emails, password encryption, creating user accounts, email confirmation requests after account creation, an entire administrative portal, basic spring boot usage, search by category and search by keyword incorporation. On the front-end you will learn a good deal of Bootstrap usage and Thymeleaf, which is much better than JSP/JSTL imo.

I've learned a lot from this course, but I think that the instructor could have done a much better job in explaining a lot of things much more clearly. A lot of the concepts that were not explained at all, I had to look up on my own in order to understand what was going on. As I already mentioned, most of the concepts are not explained at all as the instructor assumes basic knowledge of many technologies used throughout this course.
results.content_html:
Just finished this course. It is not a course for beginners to Java/Spring. If you have no previous knowledge of spring MVC, spring data, spring security, then you may want to avoid this course because there isn't much explanation given on these topics. The instructor assumes that you have knowledge of these (among many others) and most of it is never explained. Other technologies that are used but not taught include: Thymeleaf, Spring boot, Javascript, JQuery, CSS, Bootstrap, JPA entities and relationships.

All that aside, if you have some knowledge of the above and want to learn somewhat advanced topics, this is a good course. Some of the things you will learn to implement include creating shopping carts, placing checkout orders, sending automatic confirmation emails, password encryption, creating user accounts, email confirmation requests after account creation, an entire administrative portal, basic spring boot usage, search by category and search by keyword incorporation. On the front-end you will learn a good deal of Bootstrap usage and Thymeleaf, which is much better than JSP/JSTL imo.

I've learned a lot from this course, but I think that the instructor could have done a much better job in explaining a lot of things much more clearly. A lot of the concepts that were not explained at all, I had to look up on my own in order to understand what was going on. As I already mentioned, most of the concepts are not explained at all as the instructor assumes basic knowledge of many technologies used throughout this course.

results.content: Very good content. Definitely very beneficial to those who have already learned the basics of front-end and back-end website design, such as html/css/js, along with basic knowledge of mysql and java spring. Le moves fairly fast, but he is easy to follow if you at least kind of know what you're doing.
results.content_html: Very good content. Definitely very beneficial to those who have already learned the basics of front-end and back-end website design, such as html/css/js, along with basic knowledge of mysql and java spring. Le moves fairly fast, but he is easy to follow if you at least kind of know what you're doing.

There are a few issues that occur during this tutorial and the instructor doesn't answer any of them. So it can get very frustrating dealing with them.

I do not recommend this course as it can be very demotivating at times because of the lack of the engagement of the instructor with his students.
